body.p: Every human has prior knowledge and experiences that inform their daily decision making processes. Data scientists might carry these biases into their work as well. If a data scientist uses their own personal beliefs to confirm results in a study or project, this is called:

feedback.p: Correct: This occurs when a data scientists aligns their values to the data to influence the result of the data science process or the feature engineering process.
Incorrect: A confounding bias occurs when relationships or correlations with variables is seen when one does not exist.
Incorrect: Although we can not help our bias, this instance is an example of a bias.

body.p: How can you control for information bias:

multiple_choice.choice: By excluding yourself from the project.
It is not possible to control for information bias.

feedback.p: Correct: This technique has been used to control for information bias.
Incorrect: This might lead to a loss of employment.
Incorrect: No process is perfect but there are methods that can be useful to controlling information bias.
